intro: Sebaea pratensis, commonly known as the common sebaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruits are capsule-like structures containing numerous tiny seeds. Sebaea pratensis is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
